Description: Title-page with title written in an oval at top centre and in a rectangle placed in a portico of a classical building with Corinthian columns, decorated ovals with St Elias and St John the Baptist in top corners flanking the title, whole-length figures of St Paul and St Antony flanking the central rectangle, two female saints (St Eugenia and St Euphrosyna) on square column bases in lower corners flanking a cartouche with publisher's address; title to first edition of Herbert Rosweyde's "Vitae Patrum" (Antwerp: 1615) Engraving
Producer name: Published by: Jan Moretus I (his widow and sons)
Curator's comments: This is the title-page of the first edition of Heribert Rosweyde's 'Vitae Patrum', published in Antwerp by Plantin-Moretus in 1615. The design was not by Rubens, although Schneevoogt and Rooses describe this plate in their catalogues (maybe Rubens was asked to design the title-page and refused it). The title-page to the second edition was made by Cornelis Galle and designed by Abraham van Diepenbeeck; for plates in BM collection see 1891,0414.1296; 1868,0808.7584 and 1858,0417.1247.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (undescribed)
Schneevoogt 1873 / Catalogue des estampes gravées d'après P.P.Rubens (204.74)
Rooses 1886-1892 / L'Oeuvre de P. P. Rubens. Histoire et description de ses tableaux et dessins. (unnumbered) (described on pp.113-114)
Corpus Rubenianum XXI / Rubens. Book Illustrations and Title Pages (42) (cf.)
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Baptist (Prodromos)
Representation of: St Paul the Hermit
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
